comments:
I found a way to reproduce this problem, the exception occurs, but then soon after the persistentType name is set so there aren't any more problems.

Run eclipse with this configuration:  persistence Perspective open, and one class open in the editor defined as:

package model;

public class Employee {
	private int id;
}

When you run eclipse this exception will go to the error log:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument cannot be null
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3333)
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3272)

at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.setText(TreeItem.java:1538)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.setText(TreeItem.java:1570)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.doUpdateItem(TreeViewer.java:259)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer$UpdateItemSafeRunnable.run(AbstractTreeViewer.java:88)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:816)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.JFaceUtil$1.run(JFaceUtil.java:44)
at org.eclipse.jface.util.SafeRunnable.run(SafeRunnable.java:148)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.doUpdateItem(AbstractTreeViewer.java:813)

at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:816)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.JFaceUtil$1.run(JFaceUtil.java:44)
at org.eclipse.jface.util.SafeRunnable.run(SafeRunnable.java:148)

at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:69)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.createChildren(AbstractTreeViewer.java:675)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.createChildren(TreeViewer.java:849)

This was fixed as a result of changing the population process.  Now the persistentType has it's name set before it is added to the collection on PersistenceFile
